p: The extraction of B. reticularia leaves by hydrodistillation yielded 0.30% ( w/ w) of an essential oil with slightly green appearance. The phytochemical analysis by gas chromatography with mass spectrometric detection (GC-MS) revealed the presence of 16 identified compounds ( Table 1) with a majority of mono- and sesquiterpenes. The relative quantification analysis by gas chromatography with flame ionization detection GC-FID ( Table 1) indicated that the most abundant compound was d-limonene (25.7%), a precursor of monoterpene biosynthesis. An unusual component of essential oils was also found (kaurene = 0.7%).
